Read this sample answer to the writing task in the previous exercise. Complete the letter by filling each gap with the present simple of one of the verbs provided. You will use some of the verbs more than once, and in some cases you will need to use passive voice.
Writing Task 1

p.font: You won't believe this but I've just sat through 'Titanic'. I you and I swore we would never watch it but I really you might be missing a great film if you it!

It's not just about the sinking of the ship – it's a romance and a disaster film rolled into one! It in modern times and then the whole story in flashbacks by Rose, a survivor of the tragedy. The main story is about how Rose, as a young woman, from a suicide attempt by Jack, a passenger from the lower decks of the ship, and how they gradually closer to each other. The plot is full of suspense and you breathless in parts. You really can't help but get caught up in the emotions of their impossible situation and the tragedy that , though there are a few corny moments! The two main stars and the supporting cast excellent though. The costumes and the sets inside the ship are fabulous and really the period to life.
So do try and find a spare three hours or so and and it. I really do think you'll be pleasantly surprised!

section.p: Looking forward to catching up on all your news.
